instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hi there

I removed the trackpad assembly/cable on an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (2018) to install new battery in this unit. Cable is not damaged in any way, nor the trackpad. after reassembly, there is no click and no cursor. Keyboard is working fine. I tried another trackpad with no success. What might the issue be? I have not removed the logic board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Try known good trackpad cable.
Also clean the connectors.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Installed brand new trackpad cable after cleaning both connectors. No dice. Time to pull the board I guess.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: I think I found the culprit...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: <CAPACITOR>C6700</CAPACITOR> got knocked off. I guess my pry tool went under the board when removing the battery.
